channel.title: Posts on Words of Praise
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Words of Praise

item.title: The LORD Is My Rock
item.description:
I love you, LORD, my strength.

The LORD is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold. I called to the LORD, who is worthy of praise, and I have been saved from my enemies. The cords of death entangled me; the torrents of destruction overwhelmed me. The cords of the grave coiled around me; the snares of death confronted me.

item.title: Rotational Motion: Movement in Circle
item.description:
I. What is an Angle?

Before we tackle rotation, we first need to understand its elementary foundation which is an angle. An angle is a portion of a circle. “Measuring an angle” is assigning a value to that circular portion. The thing is, an angle does not appear magically though, it starts somewhere-just like anything in life has a beginning and also an end.

1. Setup Scenario

Let’s say you decide to take a walk on a circle. You will first stand at a particular spot, then start walking. Let’s call that starting point A. As you start walking, you realize that you need a break and stop for a second-this is position B—that’s our position B.
